etymology.description: 文(文) (wén, "writing") + 斦(斦) (yín, phonetic) = refinement and literary qualities
etymology.interpretation: The character 斌(斌) (bīn, "refined") combines the semantic component 文(文) (wén, "writing"), suggesting cultural or literary refinement, with the phonetic component 斦(斦) (yín). This signifies a person who is refined or scholarly.

examples.chinese: 他叫斌(他叫斌)，气质非常斌(氣質非常斌)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiào bīn, qìzhì fēicháng bīn.
examples.english: He is called Bin, and his demeanor is very refined.

examples.chinese: 经过岁月磨砺(經過歲月磨砺)，他变得沉稳斌(他變得沉穩斌)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò suìyuè mólì, tā biàn dé chénwěn bīn.
examples.english: After the tempering of time, he has become steadily refined.

examples.chinese: 他的谈吐斌(他的談吐斌)，彰显出文人的风采(彰顯出文人的風采)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de tán tǔ bīn, zhāngxiǎn chū wénrén de fēngcǎi.
examples.english: His refined manner of speaking showcases the elegance of a scholar.
